ygData.subject: Greater Lightstones.
ygData.msgSnippet: I thought they got rid of the 9PP for a greater lightstone deal with the gypsies?   Didn t you give it to them for something and then sell that item back? I
ygData.messageBody:
I thought they got rid of the 9PP for a greater lightstone deal with the
gypsies? Didn't you give it to them for something and then sell that item
back? I was told by several people that they had put a stop to that, before
I ever got a chance to try it out...

Also, has the wisp spawn on the island in Erud's Crossing changed again?
Back in May I fought there with a Ranger for a day or so before a patch and
made like 100pp selling the stones for 4 gp and change, but after the patch
the spawn was cut by two thirds and I would get a stone of any sort like
once every ten kills.... and then they added in the burned outs.... so
frustrating to loot, see a stone and get all excited to find out it's
burned out?? of course everyone is used to that now....

Cal


At 03:36 PM 10/20/99 +0000, you wrote:
>From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
>What do you mean, in an intelligent manner? What manner is that? I
>am 19th, and before I bought my banded armor, I had 98 plat in the
>bank and some change. I have 8 greater lightstones in a backpack that
>I can sell to the gypsies for around 72 plat. That put me at around
>170 plat.
> The most profitable thing at 15th level is either bronze weapons or
>greater lighstones. Both of which are semi-rare. These are the only
>things that I can think of. You can kill the occasional gem dropping mob in
>Faydwar, Pixies, or Drakes, or those winged-women things in
>Steamfont, but even those aren't that valuable or very common.
> The only other thing I can think of is that you are doing quests and
>then auctioning the items. Like doing the Shining Star of Light quest
>over and over again and then selling it for 50 pp a pop or something.
>I suppose it might fetch that much on a production server, certainly
>not on Test. Seems like the demand would run low, and most newbies
>simply can't afford that much.
>Beyond that, I can not thing of any normal means to acquire 4000 plat
>by the time you reach 15th level. It is inconceivable.
> You talk like it is common knowledge that everyone should have 4000
>plat by the time they are 15th level. That's just absurd.
>
> A friend of mine stayed up all night once and killed wisps on wisp
>isle. He sold all the greater lightstones to the gypsy camp and ended
>up making around 800 plat. It took him nearly a day to do that. He
>was 20th level.
>
>
>>From: AoS/Aosinator <darshan@...>
>>
>> >Very profitable way to hunt? Sounds like you're exploiting to me. I
>> >don't know any 15th level anythings that can shell out the 1000+ pp
>> >for an observer staff. That's a lot of greater lightstones and bronze
>> >spears.
>>
>>Can be done and has been done in the past, without use of exploits.
>>Aosinator had amassed almost 4000pp by the time she was level 15, and it
>>was by using her proceeds in an intelligent manner. Don't point the
>>accusatory finger at someone until ye know all the facts.
>>
>>-Aosinator Lightbringer
>>-Devout follower of Marr on The Rathe
>>
>>
>>-Aosinator Lightbringer
>>-Devout follower of Mithaniel Marr on The Rathe
